title.rendered: A Must-Read for Homeowners: 4 Common Problem Spots in Any Home

content.rendered:
Whether you are a new homeowner or you simply want to be more hands-on with taking good care of your home, it’s important to be aware of the common maintenance problems in almost every home. If you don’t know the potential issues the average homeowner faces, chances are that you could fail to recognize when something is not working right in your own home. Ignoring the home maintenance issues can eventually lead to major and expensive Texas home repair jobs. In this post, we have made a list of the most common problems you should be alert to as a property owner. 

Damaged Roof

The roof of your home is among the first lines of defense against the elements. It protects you from rain, hail, snow, blizzards, and even raccoons. And still, many homeowners don’t realize that in order for something to keep working perfectly, their roof should receive a certain amount of care every once in a while. 

Contact a Texas home repair company to check for any roof damage like leaks, missing or loose shingles, or asphalt shingle blistering. Failure to address these issues can compromise the structural integrity of your home.

Plumbing and Electrical Problems

If the electrical or plumbing components in your house haven’t been properly installed, they will create problems sooner or later. If you’ve moved into a new home, call Texas home services to take a look at the wiring, air vents, drain pipes, and waste systems.

At United Home Services, our technicians have a collected experience of over 50 years. This means they can always get an idea of whether or not a home’s wiring and plumbing is up to the mark. We evaluate how a house is built, what materials were used, etc. to determine whether you need to update the wiring.

Insulation

Insulation not only protects you from harsh winters but also keeps your family safe from extremely hot weather. You should hire professional Texas home services to check how sturdy your home’s insulation is in the basement and attic (among other areas).

Our insulation technicians at United Home Services can ensure your insulation is in the best shape to keep the heat – or cold – out. This includes checking for missing, deteriorated, or cracked caulking on the exterior of your house.

Water Damage

Even though it doesn’t rain in Texas as much as in, say, Florida, the risk of water damage is very real to your property. A leak in the roof or plumbing can lead to water stains throughout your house. 

A professional Texas home repair company will test your home with a moisture meter to spot any problematic areas. We will also look for visible signs of water damage like mold, rust, stains, and damaged/peeling paint.

Keep Your Home in Optimal Condition With Texas Home Services

At United Home Services, we have a team of licensed and qualified experts who can help you keep your home in top condition. Remember, prevention is better than cure. 

Schedule routine inspection and maintenance and save yourself from spending thousands of dollars in repairs down the line. Speak to us at 866-836-2341 or contact us online to get started!
